abstract.text: Destroys the map and frees file locks on the underlying file or directory.

All references related to the map should be released before destruction. If active related references exist, this method will still destroy the map, but subsequent map-related methods will fail. The results of accessing methods after destroying are undefined.
Destroying is not necessary if the map has not been loaded.
Destroys the map and frees file locks on the underlying file or directory.

All references related to the map should be released before destruction. If active related references exist, this method will still destroy the map, but subsequent map-related methods will fail. The results of accessing methods after destroying are undefined.
Destroying is not necessary if the map has not been loaded.
A Map is a class that represents the 2D map. You need to inject all the required data associated with a venue to instantiate and load a Map.
Mappy provides an elegant and composable interface for mapping, geocoding, and routing.
